summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case, specifically changing the location and detailing COVID-19 protocols for a hearing on Maxwell's motion for a new trial scheduled for March 8, 2022.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case for whom a hearing on a motion for a new trial is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the order, presiding over the case and setting the hearing details and protocols.

events.title: Hearing on Maxwell's Motion for New Trial
events.description: A court hearing scheduled to address Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial.

locations: Courtroom 110, Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Centre Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial was scheduled for March 8, 2022, at 10:00 a.m.
The hearing location was changed to Courtroom 110 of the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse in New York.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were mandated for courthouse entry, including mask requirements and a health questionnaire.
Judge Alison J. Nathan issued the order on March 3, 2022.
